Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Hotfix] Don't throw when adding a package owner without a message" (#7383) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "[Hotfix] Don't throw when adding a package owner without a message" (#7383) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Adding an owner without a message fails when sending email" (#7382) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
It appears that adding owners without a message is failing to send emails on PROD.
Fortunately the owner is still being added, but the email is failing to send.

# Reproduction steps:
1. Go to the manage page for a package you own.
2. In the owners section, enter a username, leave the "message" field blank, and submit.

Expected:
- email is sent
- owner shows up in list on page as "pending"

Actual:
"Internal Server Error" is displayed on page

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Increase tag field weight" (#7381) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Try to improve the following queries:

* aad -> microsoft.identitymodel.clients.activedirectory
* excel -> EPPlus
* mail -> SendGrid, Mailkit
* ml.net ->Microsoft.ML
* orm -> Dapper
* rx -> System.Reactive
* mysql -> MySqlConnector

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Revert "public -> internal" change in PluginProcess" (#8390) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Tracking issue for Revert "public -> internal" change in PluginProcess NuGet/NuGet.Client#2954

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "csproj equivalent to licence " (#8389) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I usually push a nuget by using 

    dotnet pack -c release

followed by:

    nuget push <package> -source nuget.org

Today suddenly I got a 403 error when trying to push. After spending a good amount of time creating api keys and restarting, I tried uploading manually from nuget.org. This shows me the error 

> All published packages should have license information specified.

The documentation says to use <license type="file">license\license.txt</license> in the .nuspec. I prefer not to have to update the .nuspec everytime and update the csproj file instead. I can't find any documentation pointing to what is to be used in the .csproj in order to generate this license tag. I have tried :

     <PackageLicense>none</PackageLicense>
      <License>none</License>

Trying `type="file"` crashes the project. I have also tried adding a License.txt file.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Clarify TargetFramework vs TargetFrameworks vs TargetFrameworkMoniker across the NUGet codebase." (#8388) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Remove CreateTempGlobalJson from NuGet.CommandLine.Test\Util.cs" (#8387) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Since the VS on CI doesn't have the latest hostfxr, it could not resolve the preview SDK3.0. So there're broken tests of running nuget restore on SDK style project. (https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/2835)
we add a temporary workaround to create a global.json file in temporary test folder, to make sure msbuild could pick preview version of SDK.

This work around should be removed when CI has the latest version of VS(according to Nick's email, should be RTM16.3), or SDK3.0 released RTM version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Increase Mac test verbosity" (#8384) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Mac tests on that run on DDMBLDM001 always timeout. Increase the verbosity to get more information.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add restriction/validation on icon file size" (#8030) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: When we will able to pack icons inside  the .nupkg, there will be a maximum limit on icon file size. The limit is set to 1 megabyte.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Apex Test InstallAndUpdatePackageWithSourceParameterWarnsAsync failing" (#8386) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
An APEX test is failing in multiple builds

https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/NuGet/_TestManagement/Runs?runId=7599252&_a=runCharts

https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=2886571

The 'Source' parameter is not respected for the transitive package management based project(s) TestProject. The enabled sources in your NuGet configuration will be used
Expected: True
Actual: False

VS:
- [x] Insertion PR: [192086](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/192086)

.NET Core (master)
- [ ] SDK https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/3436
- [x] CLI https://github.com/dotnet/cli/pull/11946
- [x] Toolset https://github.com/dotnet/toolset/pull/1699
